title: How to Make Cookies and Cream Macarons

steps.headline: Whip the egg whites and salt on high speed, in a mixer, for about 2 minutes.
Add in granulated sugar and chocolate extract and continue to beat for 1 minute until peaks form.
Pulse your Oreo cookies in blender until they turn into a powder.
Pour the powdered sugar mixture on top of the whipped egg whites.
steps.description: Keep folding mixture with a spatula. Fold the mixture until large strands fall down into the bowl when you pick up your spatula.

steps.headline: Fill a large pastry bag (that has a 1/2 inch tip) with your batter.
steps.description: Pipe circles onto a parchment lined cookie sheet.

steps.headline: Slam your cookie sheet on the counter a few times to let air escape.
steps.description: Allow macarons to air out for at least 1 hour.

steps.headline: Preheat oven to 300°F.
steps.description: Bake macarons for 17 minutes. Allow to cool completely on their tray before frosting.

steps.headline: Beat the butter with the Oreo frosting and vanilla extract until light and fluffy, about 2 minutes.
In a small blender, pulse your Oreo cookies until they form a fine powder.
Add in the crushed Oreos, powdered sugar, and whole milk, beating again until light and fluffy, 1 minute more.
Once your macarons have cooled, frost and enjoy.

text: Making the Cookie Shell Whip the egg whites and salt on high speed, in a mixer, for about 2 minutes.  Add in granulated sugar and chocolate extract and continue to beat for 1 minute until peaks form.  Pulse your Oreo cookies in blender until they turn into a powder.  Pour the powdered sugar mixture on top of the whipped egg whites. Keep folding mixture with a spatula. Fold the mixture until large strands fall down into the bowl when you pick up your spatula. Fill a large pastry bag (that has a 1/2 inch tip) with your batter. Pipe circles onto a parchment lined cookie sheet. Slam your cookie sheet on the counter a few times to let air escape. Allow macarons to air out for at least 1 hour. Preheat oven to 300°F. Bake macarons for 17 minutes. Allow to cool completely on their tray before frosting. Making the Creme Filling Beat the butter with the Oreo frosting and vanilla extract until light and fluffy, about 2 minutes.  In a small blender, pulse your Oreo cookies until they form a fine powder.  Add in the crushed Oreos, powdered sugar, and whole milk, beating again until light and fluffy, 1 minute more.  Once your macarons have cooled, frost and enjoy.
